thread.title: One Direction fans rally behind Liam Payne after Belfast gig is cancelled
thread.title_full: One Direction fans rally behind Liam Payne after Belfast gig is cancelled

title: One Direction fans rally behind Liam Payne after Belfast gig is cancelled
text:
One Direction fans rally behind Liam Payne after Belfast gig is cancelled One Direction fans rally behind Liam Payne after Belfast gig is cancelled Share 
One Direction have cancelled a concert after Liam Payne became ill. 
A spokeswoman said the 22-year-old was not seriously unwell but that it had prompted the band to pull out of tonight’s gig at the SSE Arena in Belfast. Unfortunately One Direction have had to cancel tonight's concert in Belfast. Liam has been taken suddenly (cont) https://t.co/oMtSdxlRrL 
— Simon Jones (@simonjonespr) October 20, 2015 
It is the first of three nights the boy band are due to play at the Northern Ireland venue during their On The Road Again tour. 
The spokeswoman said: “The show tonight has been cancelled as Liam has taken ill, and whilst not serious, he is unable to perform tonight. 
“Please hold on to your tickets. A further statement will be made in the morning. The band apologise to the fans and wish Liam better.” (Dominic Lipinski/PA)
